alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:42AM EST until February 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 1006.4 feet, Fourmile Road floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 1004.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM EST Friday was 1004.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 1006.9 feet this evening. It will then recede and should fall below flood stage by late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1006.9 feet on 03/28/1994. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 4 PM EST.
